senses.de: A booking for a service, such as a hotel room or a table in a restaurant.
senses.ex: I made a reservation for two at our favorite restaurant.

Tips.title: Planning Ahead
Tips.description: Used to secure a spot in advance, ensuring access to a service when it's needed.
Tips.example: Let's make a reservation at the hotel before they are fully booked.

Tips.title: Polite Requests
Tips.description: Politely ask to reserve something rather than demanding it, to show good manners.
Tips.example: Could I please have a reservation for a window seat on the flight?

Tips.title: Specific Details
Tips.description: Be clear about the details when making a reservation, like date, time, and preferences.
Tips.example: I'd like to make a reservation for two people at 7 PM this Friday.

senses.de: A feeling of doubt or not fully agreeing with something.
senses.ex: I have my reservations about the plan.

Tips.title: Cautious Support
Tips.description: Shows support with some doubts, indicating you're not fully convinced.
Tips.example: I'll support the project, but I have some reservations about its cost.

Tips.title: Soft Disagreement
Tips.description: A polite way to express disagreement or concern without being blunt or confrontational.
Tips.example: I have reservations about changing our process right now.

senses.de: An area of land set aside for a specific purpose, such as for the Indigenous people of the United States.
senses.ex: The Sioux tribe lives on a reservation in South Dakota.

Tips.title: Cultural Sensitivity
Tips.description: Understand reservations are home to indigenous people and respect their cultural significance.
Tips.example: The wildlife reserve is next to the reservation; both are protected areas.

Tips.title: Specific Terminology
Tips.description: Recognize that in some contexts, 'reservation' refers to specific geographic areas, often related to indigenous peoples.
Tips.example: The reservation is governed by its own tribal council.

senses.de: A term in contract law where a party may plan or save something for a future use.
senses.ex: The contract contains a reservation of rights clause.

Tips.title: Legal Caution
Tips.description: In contracts, a reservation clarifies rights retained, often for use in potential future issues.
Tips.example: The company included a reservation of rights in case of a breach.

Tips.title: Contract Precision
Tips.description: Ensure clarity and prevent misunderstandings by explicitly stating reservations in contracts.
Tips.example: The lease has a reservation clause that specifies the landlord's rights.

Appointment.wordDefinition:
An appointment is a specific time set for a meeting or service with a professional such as a doctor, hair stylist or lawyer.

An appointment is a set time for a specific service with a professional, while a reservation is a request to hold a specific space or service for a group or individual at a specific time.

Arrangement.wordDefinition:
Arrangement is used when you're organizing or planning something for a future action, event, or situation. For example, making an arrangement for a meeting, arranging for transportation, or making arrangements for a party.

The key difference is that arrangement is about planning while reservation is about holding something for a specific time or purpose.

Book.wordDefinition:
Book usually means to reserve or purchase a physical copy of a reading material, such as a book, magazine, or newspaper.

It is applicable in a bookstore or library setting where you go to get a copy of a reading material.

Book is applicable when you want to secure a physical copy of reading material, whereas reservation is applicable when you need to secure a spot or time for an activity or service.

Engage.wordDefinition:
Engage means to participate in or become involved in something. For example, if you engage in a conversation, you are actively participating in it.

Engage is applicable when you want to actively participate in something, while reservation is applicable when you want to book or hold something for future use.

Hire.wordDefinition:
Hire means to pay someone to work for you, or to rent something for a short period of time. For example, you could hire a plumber to fix your sink, or you could hire a car for the weekend.

Hire is used for paying someone to work for you or renting something, while reservation is used for booking something in advance for a specific time or date.

Hold.wordDefinition:
Hold and reservation are two words that are similar in meaning but are used in different contexts.

Hold typically means to keep something for a short period of time, often to reserve it or set it aside for someone else.

For example, you might ask a store to put a particular item on hold for you so you can come back later and buy it. Or you might ask your friend to hold your phone while you tie your shoes.

Hold is more informal and short-term, while reservation is more formal and long-term.

Reserve.wordDefinition:
Reservation means the act of reserving something in advance, such as a hotel room, a flight ticket, or a restaurant table.

Reserve means to keep something for a later use, or to hold something back from use or consumption. It is applicable when you want to save something for a specific purpose or situation.

Reservation is used when you need to book or hold something in advance, while reserve is used when you want to keep something for later use or save it for a specific purpose.

Stipulate.wordDefinition:
Stipulate means to require or demand something as a condition of an agreement or contract. For example, if you are negotiating a business deal, you may stipulate that certain terms and conditions must be met before you agree to sign the contract.

Reservation is about setting something aside, while stipulate is about demanding certain conditions be met. Both words are applicable in a variety of contexts, from making travel arrangements to negotiating business deals.

quotes.Text: For those who support same-sex marriage - and I support it without reservation - the ideal of equality and the belief in the dignity of same-sex relationships necessarily makes the issue seem a great deal like the civil-rights struggles of the past.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Benjamin Wittes

quotes.Text: I'm absolutely scared and I absolutely have reservations, but sometimes you need to find that deep down in you to bring out the best performance of yourself, to bring out the best version of yourself, but yep I'm nervous and I'm scared.
quotes.Title: American Wrestler
quotes.Name: Britt Baker

quotes.Text: I grew up in Oregon so I grew up around reservations, so I've always kind of had this knowledge. Not a tremendous amount of knowledge, but an outsider's knowledge of what reservation life was like.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Katee Sackhoff

quotes.Text: Any man worth his salt will stick up for what he believes right, but it takes a slightly better man to acknowledge instantly and without reservation that he is in error.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Andrew Jackson

quotes.Text: I have a pretty good knowledge of the Indian world by virtue of living on several different reservations and being exposed to several different cultures and languages.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: N. Scott Momaday

quotes.Text: I mean, it's nice to get a dinner reservation ahead of other people, but when it comes down to it, the most important thing to me is the actual work.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Scarlett Johansson

quotes.Text: I honestly have really deep reservations about releasing everything you ever did. Every time somebody farted in the studio, now it's out there.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Paul Rodgers

quotes.Text: My mother was a Mohawk, born and raised on a reservation, and when I was a kid, she would take me there to visit her relatives.
quotes.Title: Canadian Musician
quotes.Name: Robbie Robertson

quotes.Text: As a teenager, I worked on Indian reservations, and it was such an incredible culture: the elders are so respected.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Winona Ryder

quotes.Text: I never have reservations about doing anything as long as I'm being paid.
quotes.Title: British Actor
quotes.Name: Colin Baker
